abstract: Returns the set of locales that are supported by the speech recognizer.
overview:
## Return Value

A set of locales that support speech recognition.

## Discussion

This method returns the locales for which speech recognition is supported. Support for a locale does not guarantee that speech recognition is currently possible for that locale. For some locales, the speech recognizer requires an active Internet connection to communicate with Apple’s servers. If the speech recognizer is currently unable to process requests,   [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognizer/isAvailable] returns `false`.

Speech recognition supports the same locales that are supported by the keyboard’s dictation feature. For a list of these locales, see [https://www.apple.com/ios/feature-availability/#quicktype-keyboard-dictation].

# supportedLocales()

**Type Method**

Returns the set of locales that are supported by the speech recognizer.

## Declaration

```swift
class func supportedLocales() -> Set<Locale>
```

## Return Value

A set of locales that support speech recognition.

## Discussion

This method returns the locales for which speech recognition is supported. Support for a locale does not guarantee that speech recognition is currently possible for that locale. For some locales, the speech recognizer requires an active Internet connection to communicate with Apple’s servers. If the speech recognizer is currently unable to process requests,   [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognizer/isAvailable] returns `false`.

Speech recognition supports the same locales that are supported by the keyboard’s dictation feature. For a list of these locales, see [https://www.apple.com/ios/feature-availability/#quicktype-keyboard-dictation].

## Getting the current language

- **locale**: The locale of the speech recognizer.
